Text: Come, let us sing for joy to the LORD; let us shout aloud to the Rock of our salvation.
Context: The psalm opens with a call to joyful praise, which sets the tone for worship and reverence.

Text: Let us come before Him with thanksgiving and extol Him with music and song.
Context: The psalmist continues the theme of joyful worship, mentioning thanksgiving as a key component.

Text: For the LORD is the great God, the great King above all gods.
Context: This verse expresses awe towards God’s supremacy over all other deities and powers.

Text: In His hand are the depths of the earth, and the mountain peaks belong to Him.
Context: The verse emphasizes God's ownership and control over all creation.

Text: The sea is His, for He made it, and His hands formed the dry land.
Context: The creation theme continues, highlighting God's power and role as creator.

Text: Come, let us bow down in worship; let us kneel before the LORD our Maker.
Context: An invitation to worship the Creator, emphasizing physical gestures of bowing and kneeling.

Text: For He is our God, and we are the people of His pasture, the flock under His care. Today, if you hear His voice,
Context: It reflects on the relationship between God and His people, likening them to a flock He shepherds.

Text: do not harden your hearts as at Meribah, as on that day at Massah in the wilderness,
Context: A stark warning against repeating the rebellion and hard-heartedness of the Israelites in the Exodus story.

Text: where your fathers tested and tried Me, though they had seen My work.
Context: The verse recounts the testing of God by the Israelites in the desert despite witnessing His deeds.

Text: For forty years I was angry with that generation; I said, ‘They are a people whose hearts go astray, and they have not known My ways.’
Context: God's frustration is expressed regarding the Israelites' continued disobedience over forty years.

Text: So I declared on oath in My anger, ‘They shall never enter My rest.’
Context: The conclusion of the psalm ties back to the rebellion in the desert, with God swearing they would not enter His rest.
